                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>Affirmative Sentence কে Negative Interrogative করার জন্য Tense অনুযায়ী &nbsp;sub+main verb+বাকি অংশে বসবে।</p>\r\n<p>এখানে,বাক্যটি Past Indefinite Tense হওয়ার জন্য Did দিয়ে শুরু হয়েছে এবং Negative করার জন্য শুরুতে &nbsp;Did not &nbsp;দেয়া হয়েছে।</p>"
            }

    {
        "admission_test": "CKRUET",
        "university": "KUET",
        "unit": "",
        "year": "2015",
        "chapter": "Sentence Correction",
        "has_passage": false,
        "passage": null,
        "block": [
            {
                "text": "<p><span>Choose the correct sentence from the followings.</span></p>",
                "options": [
                    {
                        "text": "Riches are not always happy.",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "Rich is not always happy.",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "The rich is not always happy.",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "The rich are not always happy.",
                        "is_correct": true
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "Rich are not always happy.",
                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>In the sentence, &ldquo;The rich are not always happy&hellip;,&rdquo; the word &ldquo;rich&rdquo; is a plural noun, requiring &ldquo;are.&rdquo; The rich are, the poor are, the children are, the elderly are, the cattle are, the oxen are, and the police are. Sometimes one fish is, sometimes many fish are. The Senate is, the legislature is, the governing board is, the officer corps is, the faculty is (at least in the US). The family is even though the children are.</p>\r\n<p>Having said all that, I&rsquo;ll add that I realize I&rsquo;m not providing much practical help.</p>\r\n<p>No one has authorized me to say that these are official rules, but here are some thoughts:</p>\r\n<p>&gt; First: Please don&rsquo;t fall into the trap of assuming that all plurals in English are formed by adding &ldquo;s.&rdquo; The plural of man is men; the plural of woman is women; and on it goes with some of the examples that I gave above, like children and oxen, all plural nouns.</p>\r\n<p>&gt; Second: I believe the experts may tell us that plural nouns and collective nouns are two different things. Senate, legislature, faculty are collective nouns. Arsenal, Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester City are collective nouns as well as proper nouns. What you want to notice about collective nouns is that the British like to use the plural form of verbs with collective nouns, whereas Americans use the singular form: The Boston baseball team &ldquo;is&rdquo; proud of its history; Tottenham Hotspur &ldquo;are&rdquo; proud of their history. You also want to notice that both Americans and the British use the plural form of verbs with plural nouns like children, cattle and police. In other words, both in the US and in the UK, children are, cattle are, police are. Got it? The Boston team is, Tottenham are, the police are</p>"
            }
        ]
    },

                "explanation": "<p>Parallelism এর নিয়মানুযায়ী উভয় পাশে সেইম Tense/parts of speech হবে। যেহেতু প্রথমে having + v3 আছে। সেহেতু পরবর্তীতেও having + v3 হবে।</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>"
            }
        ]

                        "is_correct": false
                    },

                    },

                        "text": "for 5 years",
                        "is_correct": true
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "till now",
                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>Present perfect tense এ Extension হিসেবে একটি নির্দিষ্ট সময়কাল (A certain period of time) নির্দেশ করতে \"for\" ব্যবহৃত।</p>\r\n<p><strong>সম্পূর্ণ বাক্যটি হবে</strong>- \"I have lived in Cumilla for 5 years.\"<br>যার অর্থ- \"আমি পাঁচ বছর ধরে কুমিল্লায় থাকি।\"</p>\r\n<p>এখানে, \"5 years\" একটি নির্দিষ্ট সময়কাল। তাই এর পূর্বে \"for\" ব্যবহৃত হবে। এক্ষেত্রে \"for 5 years ago\" হবে না কারণ এটি দ্বারা \"৫ বছর পূর্বে কুমিল্লায় বাস করত; এখন আর করে না\" এমনটা বুঝাবে।</p>"

                ],
                "explanation": "<p><strong>Before দ্বারা Future Time clause বুঝালে সেক্ষেত্রে Rule টি নিম্নরূপ :&nbsp;</strong></p>\r\n<p>Future tense (main clause) +before + simple present&nbsp;(Time clause).</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ex</strong>: We shall finish the work before he comes back.</p>\r\n<p>এখানে, \"We shall finish the work\" অংশটি একটি main clause যা Future tense এ আছে। অন্যদিকে \"before\" এর পরের অংশটি একটি &nbsp;Time clause. উপরোক্ত নিয়মানুসারে তাই এখানে 'Simple present' ব্যবহৃত হবে। আবার \"before\" দ্বারা Past time clause বুঝালে \"before\" এর পূর্বে Past perfect এবং পরে Simple past হবে।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ex</strong>: The train had started before I reached the station.</p>"
            }
        ]
    },

                "explanation": "<p><strong>সম্পূর্ণ বাক্যটি হবে</strong>- \"I really like eating spaghetti.\" যার অর্থ-\"আমি স্প্যাঘেটি ( এক ধরনের সেমাইজাতীয় ইতালীয় খাবার) খেতে পছন্দ করি।\"</p>\r\n<p>এখানে<strong> \"spaghetti\" </strong>একটি <strong>uncountable</strong> <strong>noun</strong> এবং এখানে \"spaghetti\" নির্দিষ্ট করে বুঝানো হয় নি। তাই এর সাথে কোনো&nbsp;article ব্যবহৃত হবে না।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ans:&nbsp;</strong>Spaghetti</p>"
            }
        ]

        "chapter": "Tag Question",
        "has_passage": false,
        "passage": null,
        "block": [
            {
                "text": "<span>Upon _______ the hall, he found everyone waiting for him, __________ he?</span>",
                "options": [
                    {
                        "text": "<span>entering, don't</span>",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "<span>entering, didn't</span>",
                        "is_correct": true
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "<span>enter, hadn't</span>",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "<span>enterance, would</span>",
                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>Upon - immediately after doing something or after something happens.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Upon</strong>&nbsp;দ্বারা<strong> \"কোনো কিছু ঘটার পরপর\"</strong> এমনটা বুঝালে এর পরের&nbsp;<strong>main verb</strong> এর সাথে <strong>ing</strong> যুক্ত হয়।</p>\r\n<p>এখানে \"Upon\" দ্বারা \"হলে প্রবেশের পরপর\" বুঝাচ্ছে, তাই এরপর main verb (enter) + ing হবে।</p>\r\n<p>আবার sentence টি একটি <strong>Complex sentence</strong>, Complex sentence এর tag question করার ক্ষেত্রে ঐ sentence এর <strong>principal/main clause</strong> এর <strong>subject</strong> এবং <strong>verb</strong> অনুসারে <strong>tag</strong> করতে হয়। এখানে principal/main clause টি হচ্ছে- <strong>\"he found everyone waiting for him\"</strong> অংশটি এবং এটি <strong>past indefinite tense</strong> এ থাকায় এর <strong>negative tag </strong>হিসেবে <strong>didn't</strong> ব্যবহৃত হবে।</p>\r\n<p><strong>সম্পূর্ণ বাক্যটি হবে</strong>- \"Upon entering the hall, he found everyone waiting for him, didn&rsquo;t he?\"</p>\r\n<p>যার অর্থ- \"হলে প্রবেশের পরপরই, সে সবাইকে তার জন্য অপেক্ষারত অবস্থায় দেখল, সে কি দেখেনি?\"</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ans: </strong>entering, didn't</p>"
            }
        ]
    },

                "explanation": "<p><strong>3rd conditional:</strong></p>\r\n<p>i) If + past perfect + sub + would have/could&nbsp;have/might have + v3.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Example:</strong>&nbsp;If you had called me, I would have gone.</p>\r\n<p>ii) Had + subject + V3 +...........+ sub + would&nbsp;have/could have/might have + v3.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Example:</strong> Had she known about it, she would have stayed longer.</p>\r\n<p>এখানে would এবং might দুটোই grammatically সঠিক। তবে, <strong>সম্ভাবনা</strong> বুঝাতে <strong>might</strong> ব্যবহৃত হয়। কিন্তু, প্রদত্ত sentence টির অর্থ হচ্ছে- <strong>\"সে যদি এটি সম্পর্কে জানতো, তাহলে সে দীর্ঘক্ষণ থাকতো।\"</strong></p>\r\n<p>তাই, অর্থনুযায়ী <strong>would</strong> বসবে।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ans: </strong>would</p>"

Despite its antiquity, certain aspects of its construction make it one of the truly great wonders of the world. The thirteen-acre structure near the Nile River is a solid mass of stone blocks covered with limestone. Inside are a number of hidden passageways and the burial chamber for the pharaoh. It is the largest single structure in the world. The four sides of the pyramid are aligned almost exactly in the true north, south, east, and west&mdash;an incredible engineering feat. The ancient Egyptians were sun worshipers and great astronomers, so computations for the great pyramid were based on astronomical observations. Explorations and detailed examinations of the base of the structure reveal many intersecting lines. Further scientific study indicates that these represent a type of timeline of events past, present, and future. Many of the events have been interpreted and found to coincide with known facts from the past. Others are prophesied for future generations and are currently under investigation. Many believe that pyramids have supernatural powers, and this one is no exception. Some researchers even associate it with extraterrestrial beings from the ancient past.                 "explanation": "<ul>\r\n<li><strong>Grant</strong> অর্থ মঞ্জুর করা, প্রদান করতে সম্মত হওয়া।</li>\r\n<li><strong>'Grant' </strong>verb টি সাধারণত <strong>passive</strong> এ ব্যবহৃত হয়। তাই <strong>has&nbsp;been granted</strong> অথবা<strong> was granted</strong> হবে।</li>\r\n<li>যেহেতু কাজটি <strong>অতীতের</strong> তাই <strong>was granted</strong> সঠিক উত্তর।</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><strong>Ans:&nbsp;</strong>created, was granted</p>"

                "explanation": "<p>Dexterity - কর্মদক্ষতা/হাত দিয়ে কাজের দক্ষতা।<br>Stupidity - মূর্খতা।<br>Austerity - কঠোরতা।<br>Ingenuity - উদ্ভাবনী দক্ষতা।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Dexterity এর গুরুত্বপূর্ণ কিছু Synonym &amp; Antonym:</strong></p>\r\n<p><strong>Synonyms</strong>: Adroitness, Aptitude, Capability, Ingenuity,&nbsp;Proficiency, Efficiency.<br><strong>Antonyms</strong>: Incompetence, Ineptitude, Dullness, Stupidity.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Answer: D</strong>.</p>"
            }

                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "wakes up.... and goes jogging",
                        "is_correct": true
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>Every morning দ্বারা sentence টি বর্তমানের অভ্যাসগত কাজ বুঝাচ্ছে। তাই, present indefinite হবে sentence টি। আবার, go jogging - জগিং এ যাওয়া/ আস্তে আস্তে দৌড়ে ব্যায়াম করা।<br>তাই, option 'D' সঠিক।</p>"

                "explanation": "<p>Uneasy lies the head that <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">wears</span> a <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">crown</span> - যে শিরে মুকুট থাকে সে শির স্বস্তিতে থাকে না।</p>\r\n<p><strong>গুরুত্বপূর্ণ কিছু Proverbs:</strong></p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>United we stand, divided we fall- একতাই বল, বিভেদে পতন।</li>\r\n<li>A bad workman quarrels. with his tools- নাচতে না জানলে উঠান বাঁকা।</li>\r\n<li>While there is life, there is hope- যতক্ষণ শ্বাস, ততক্ষণ আঁশ।</li>\r\n<li>As you sow, So you reap - যেমন কর্ম, তেমন ফল।</li>\r\n<li>To add insult to injury - কাটা গায়ে নুনের ছিটে।</li>\r\n<li>Good wine needs no bush - চেনা বামুনের পৈতা লাগে না।</li>\r\n<li>Out of sight means out of mind - চোখের আড়াল হলেই মনের আড়াল হয়।</li>\r\n<li>Money begets money - টাকায় টাকা আনে।</li>\r\n<li>The very ruins of greatness are great - -মরা হাতি লাখ টাকা।</li>\r\n<li>One swallow does not make a summer - এক মাঘে শীত যায় না।</li>\r\n<li>Out of debt, out of danger- কর্জ নাই, কষ্ট নাই।</li>\r\n</ul>"

                    }

The prize was originally called the Booker-McConnell Prize, which was the name of the company that sponsored it, though it was better known as simply the 'Booker Prize'. In 2002, the Man Group became the sponsor, and they chose the new name, keeping 'Booker'. Publishers can submit books for consideration for the prize, but the judges can also ask for books to be submitted they think should be included. Firstly, the Advisory Committee gives advice if there have been any changes to the rules for the prize and selects the people who will judge the books. The judging panel changes every year, and usually, a person can be a judge once only. Great efforts are made to ensure that the judging panel is balanced in terms of gender and professions within the industry, so that a writer, a critic, an editor, and an academic are chosen along with a well-known person from wider society. However, when the panel of judges has been finalized, they are left to make their own decisions without any further involvement or interference from the prize sponsor. The Man Booker judges include critics, writers, and academics to maintain the consistent quality of the prize, and its influence is such that the winner will almost certainly see the sales increase considerably, in addition to the $5,000 that comes with the prize.</span>",

Following the Revolution, members of Congress had hotly debated the question of a permanent home for themselves and for those departments&mdash;the Treasury, the Patent Office, and so on&mdash;which even the sketchiest of central governments would feel obliged to establish. In 1790, largely in order to put an end to congressional bickering, George Washington was charged with selecting a site for the newly designated federal district. Not much to anyone's surprise but the disappointment of many, he chose a tract of land on the banks of the Potomac River, a few miles upstream from his beloved plantation, Mount Vernon. The District of Columbia was taken in part from Virginia and in part from Maryland. At the time it was laid out, its hundred square miles consisted of gently rolling hills, some under cultivation and the rest heavily wooded, with a number of creeks and much swampy land along the Potomac. There is now a section of Washington that is commonly referred to as Foggy Bottom; that section bore the same nickname a hundred and eighty years ago. Two portcities, Alexandria and Georgetown, flourished within sight of the new capital and gave it access by ship to the most important cities of the infant nation&mdash;Charleston, Baltimore, Philadelphia, New York, Newport, Salem, and Portsmouth&mdash;and also to the far-off parts of England and the Continent.</span>",

                "explanation": "<p><strong>Hardly had বাক্যের শুরুতে থাকলে -</strong></p>\r\n<p><strong>Structure</strong>: Hardly had + subject + verb(p.p) + when + subj. + verb (past)</p>\r\n<p><strong>Example</strong>: Hardly had we reached the station when&nbsp;the train left.</p>\r\n<p>এখানে, option 'D' তে has না হয়ে had হবে কারণ sentence টি past tense এ আছে।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ans:&nbsp;</strong>D</p>"
            }

                "explanation": "<p>Sentence টি subjunctive এর example, subjunctive&nbsp;এর structure -</p>\r\n<p>subjunctive + that + v (base form) + obj</p>\r\n<p><strong>Example </strong>- The doctor advised that he give up smoking.</p>\r\n<p>অনুরূপভাবে, Our class teacher suggested that we bring textbook&nbsp;to the classroom every day.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Subjunctive words :</strong></p>\r\n<table style=\"border-collapse: collapse; width: 55.8087%;\" border=\"1\"><colgroup><col style=\"width: 19.9544%;\"><col style=\"width: 19.9544%;\"><col style=\"width: 19.9544%;\"><col style=\"width: 19.9544%;\"><col style=\"width: 19.9544%;\"></colgroup>\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td>Demand</td>\r\n<td>Advise</td>\r\n<td>Want</td>\r\n<td>Officer</td>\r\n<td>Insist</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td>Allow</td>\r\n<td>Ask</td>\r\n<td>Prefer</td>\r\n<td>Mandate</td>\r\n<td>Forbid</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td>Beg</td>\r\n<td>Urge</td>\r\n<td>Purpose</td>\r\n<td>Intent</td>\r\n<td>Require</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>"

        "passage": "<span>When another old cave is discovered in the south of France, it is not usually news. Rather, it is an ordinary event. Such discoveries are so frequent these days that hardly anybody pays heed to them. However, when the Lascaux cave complex was discovered in 1940, the world was amazed. Painted directly on its wall were hundreds of scenes showing how people lived thousands of years ago. The scenes show people hunting animals, such as bison or wild cats. Other images depict birds and, most noticeably, horses, which appear in more than 300 wall images, by far outnumbering all other animals. Early artists drawing these animals accomplished a monumental and difficult task. They did not limit themselves to the easily accessible wall but carried their painting materials to spaces that required climbing steep walls or crawling into narrow passages in the Lascaux complex. Unfortunately, the paintings have been exposed to the destructive action of water and temperature changes, which easily wear the images away. Because the Lascaux caves have many entrances, air movement has also damaged the images inside. Although they are not out in the open air, where natural light would have destroyed them long ago, many of the images have deteriorated and are barely recognizable. To prevent further damage, the site was closed to tourists in 1963, 23 years after it was discovered.</span>",

                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "although",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "so",
                        "is_correct": true
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "since",
                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>Engineering ফ্যাকাল্টির কিছু ছাত্র পরিকল্পনা করছে ইংল্যান্ড যেতে, তাই তারা English শিখছে।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Rules:</strong> কোনো clause এর ফলাফল বা সিদ্ধান্তকে নির্দেশ করতে Sub-ordinating conjunction হিসেবে so ব্যবহার হয়।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Example:</strong> It was a long journey, so I'm really tired now.</p>\r\n<p>একইভাবে এবাক্যে ফলাফল নির্দেশ করতে sub-ordinating conjunction হিসেবে so ব্যবহার করা হয়েছে।&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong>Answer: </strong>so.</p>"

        "passage": "<span>Read the following passage and choose the alternative A, B, C, or D that best answers the questions. In recent years, there has been an increasing awareness of the inadequacies of the judicial system in the United States. Costs are staggering both for the taxpayers and the litigants and the litigants or parties have to wait sometimes many years before having their day in court. Many suggestions have been made concerning methods of ameliorating the situation, but as in most 5 branches of government, changes come slowly. One suggestion that has been made in order to maximize the efficiency of the system is to allow districts that have an abundance of pending cases to borrow judges from other districts that do not have such a backlog. Another suggestion is to use pretrial conferences, in which judges meet in their chambers with the litigants and their attorneys in order to narrow the issues, limit the winters, and 10 provide for a more orderly trial. The theory behind pretrial is that judges will spend less time on each case and parties will more readily settle before trial when they realize the adequacy of their claims and their opponents' evidence. Unfortunately, at least one study has shown that pretrial conferences use more judicial time than they save, rarely result in pretrial settlements, and actually result in higher damage settlements. 15 Many states have now established another method, small-claims courts, in which cases over small sums of 2 money can be disposed of with considerable dispatch. Such proceedings cost the litigants almost nothing. In California, for example, the parties must appear before the judge without the assistance of the counsel. The proceedings are quite informal and there is no pleading litigants need to make only a one-sentence statement of their claim. By going to this type of 20 court, the plaintiff waives any right to a jury trial and the right to appeal the decision. In coming years, we can expect to see more and more innovations in the continuing effort to remedy a situation that must be remedied if the citizens who have valid claims are going to be able to have their day in court.</span>",

                        "text": "drowning child rescued he",
                        "is_correct": false

                "explanation": "<p>এখানে Modifier (Plunging into the water) টি the drowning child কে modify করছে না। কারণ এক্ষেত্রে sentence টির meaning হয় এমন -&nbsp; \"পানিতে ঝাঁপ দেওয়ার পর ডুবন্ত শিশুটিকে উদ্ধার করা হল\", কিন্তু যদি modifier এর সাথে সামঞ্জস্য রেখে he কে subject করা হয়, তবে এক্ষেত্রে অর্থ দাড়ায় পানিতে ঝাঁপ দেওয়ার পর সে ডুবন্ত শিশুটিকে উদ্ধার করেছিল। তাহলে তা modifier এর সাথে মিলে যায় এবং sentence টি&nbsp; অর্থবোধক হয়।</p>\r\n<p>Answer: he rescued the drowning child.</p>"

For example, brass is an alloy of the metals copper and zinc, and steel is an alloy of the metal iron with nonmetal carbon. The special characteristics of metals, such as hardness, strength, flexibility, and weight are called their properties. By the process of alloying, it is possible to create materials with the exact combinations of properties for particular use. In the aircraft industry, there is a need for metals that are both strong and light. Steel is strong but too heavy, whereas aluminium is light but not strong. By mixing aluminium with copper and other metals, an alloy is created that is strong to withstand the stresses of flight, but light enough to reduce the cost of fuel to lift the aircraft. There is an important difference between the alloys created by us and the combination of metals that occur accidentally as impure metals. Both are mixtures, but alloys are mixtures that have been deliberately combined in specific proportions for definite purposes.</span>",

                "text": "<p><span>Shubho ate four pieces of Hilsha fish at dinner. 'The passive form of the sentence is -</span></p>",

                    {

                        "text": "At dinner four pieces of Hilsha fish Shubho ate.",

                        "text": "Four pieces of Hilsha fish were eating by Shubho at dinner.",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "At dinner four pieces of Hilsha fish were eaten by Shubho.",
                        "is_correct": true
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p><strong>Active voice এ sentence টি-</strong> Past indefinite tense এ আছে।<br>Past indefinite tense এর <strong>voice change</strong> <strong>করার structure </strong>হলো-</p>\r\n<p>Object এর subject + was/were + V(P. P) + by + subject এর object.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Active:&nbsp;</strong>He killed four dogs yesterday.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Passive:</strong> Four dogs were killed by him yesterday.</p>\r\n<p>অনুরূপভাবে, 'At dinner four pieces of Hilsha fish were eaten by Shubho' হবে।</p>"
            }
        ]

                "explanation": "<p>Spurious - কৃত্তিম/ভেজাল<br>Cautious - সতর্ক&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Fantastic - চমৎকার<br>Modest - ভদ্র&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Genuine - খাটি/আসল</p>\r\n<p><strong>Spurious এর কিছু Synonym এবং Antonym :</strong></p>\r\n<p><strong>Synonym :</strong> Bogus, False, Deceitful, Artificial, Fake.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Antonym :</strong> Real, Genuine, True, Valid, Authentic.</p>"

These songs are also about social inequality and property, about the material world and the supernatural. Mystical songs have been composed using the metaphors of rivers and boats. since the country is basically riverine, the bhatiyali forms an important genre of folk music. Folk music is formed and developed according to the environment. Differences in the natural environment are reflected in the people of the different regions. The dialects too vary across the different regions. Bangladesh folk music therefore varies from region to region. Thus there are the northern Bhawaiya, the eastern Bhatiyaliand the southwestern Baul songs. Folk songs are sung individually or in chorus. Folk songs sung individually include Baul, Bhatiyali, Murshidi and Marfati, while songs sung in chorus include Kabigan, Leto, Alkap and Gambhira, some songs are regional in character, but others are common to both Bangladesh and West Bengal.</span>",

        "unit": "Unit-D",
        "year": "2018",
        "chapter": "Comprehension",
        "has_passage": true,
        "passage": "<span>Read the following passage and answer the following questions.</span>\r\n<span>Even a few years ago very few people had even heard of the word Internet. Now it would be difficult to find anyone who has no beard of a Many of us use it on a regular basis, and most of us have access to it at our homes too. The 'net' in the Internet stands for network. A network is two or more computers connected together so that information can be shared or sent from one to the other. The Internet is a vast resource for all types of information. You may enjoy using it to do research, download your favourite song or communicate with family and friends. It is like a giant bulletin board for the whole world to see, Since anyone can put anything on the Internet, one must be very careful and use both judgement and common sense while accessing and using Internet sources.</span>",

        "passage": "<span>Read the following passage and answer the following questions.</span>\r\n<span>Ageing is a normal process of human development that takes place on several levels: biological, psychological and social. Although it is not certain what causes ageing, most gerontologists would agree that ageing is the result of a combination of both internal and external processes. The 'wear-and-tear theory' compares the human body to a machine that over time wears down from use. According to this theory, bodily systems receive cumulative damage from external forces, such as stress, the environment, diet, and lifestyle; and internal forces, such as toxins, released as a result of metabolism. Cells become damaged and increasingly fail to reproduce or repair themselves. They die off in larger numbers as we age. The 'combination theory' explains that although individuals can prolong life by modifying outside influences such as stress and diet, each person is born with a genetically predetermined life expectancy that cannot be exceeded. This interaction of external factors and internal programming would account for individual variations in the lifespan. The mystery surrounding why we age is still a topic of numerous ongoing studies. Perhaps, one day we will truly know why we age.</span>",

                        "is_correct": false
                    }

                "explanation": "<ul>\r\n<li>Neither/Either + Noun + nor/or + Plural noun + Plural verb</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><strong>Ex: </strong>Neither the teacher nor the students want to use this&nbsp;book again.</p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>Nor এরপরে plural noun এজন্য third person এর সাথে s/es&nbsp;যুক্ত হয়নি।</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><strong>Ex:</strong> Either Rahim or his friends are going to the beach today.</p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>Neither/Either + Noun + nor/or + singular noun + singular verb</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><strong>Ex:</strong> Neither Rahim nor Karim is going to the beach today.</p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>Nor এরপরে singular noun এজন্য verb is হবে person এর সাথে s/es যুক্ত হয়নি।</li>\r\n</ul>"
            }

Twenty lives were lost and nearly 40,000 people were displaced, with damages topping $,2.7 billion. The disaster, known as the Lusi mudflow, continues to have its impact till now. A mud volcano, Lusiexpels water and clay rather than molten rock. Such eruptions occur around the world, but Lusi is the biggest and most damaging known. Scientists debated the cause for years, and two intensely argued hypotheses have emerged: Some believe an earthquake set off the disaster, and others that the mudflow was caused by a company drilling for natural gas. Researchers largely relied on computer models and comparisons with others. earthquakes and mud volcano eruptions. But recently scientists uncovered a previously overlooked set of gas, readings collected at the drilling site by Lapindo Brantas, a natural gas and oil company, in the days before the mudflow began.                         "is_correct": true
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "I too am",
                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>প্রশ্নটি Affirmative agreement- এর উদাহরণ- Affirmative agreement এর ক্ষেত্রে -</p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li style=\"text-align: justify;\">Affirmative Statement + And + Subject + Verb + Too</li>\r\n<li style=\"text-align: justify;\">Affirmative Statement + And + So + Verb + Subject</li>\r\n</ul>"
            }

This environmental degradation is a clear result of acid rain, increased levels of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere, and other forms of air pollution. Acid rain and air pollution, for instance, are devastating forests, crops, and lakes over wide areas all over the world. Since the 1950s, carbon dioxide levels in the atmosphere have increased by 13%, setting the stage for global warming. As atmospheric temperature rises, grain output may significantly decrease, making it more difficult for farmers to keep pace with the growth of the population. In urban areas, air pollution is taking a toll on buildings and human health. To reduce the amount of environmental damage in cities, developed countries have devised technology to control harmful emissions. However, as these countries already have an abundance of vehicles that continue to grow in number, the efficacy of these measures is diminished. Since cars and other vehicles create more air pollution than any other human activity, the most effective means to reduce pollution is to decrease the number of vehicles.                         "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "This, are",
                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>কিছু কিছু noun আছে যার Singular এবং Plural form একই থাকে। অর্থাৎ এদের সাথে কখনও s বা es যোগ হয় না।</p>\r\n<p>যেমন - Pair, Dozen, Sheep, Deer, Canon, Salmon, Gross. যেহেতু pair এর পর কখনও s বা es হয় না তাই এর পূর্বে this বসবে। আবার, Preposition এর পূর্বের অংশ Subject হিসেবে ব্যবহৃত হয়। এখানে 'This Pair' Subject আর This Pair Singular বলে পরবর্তী Verb টিও Singular (is) হবে।</p>"
            }
        ]

Not simply because it is grossly unjust for women to be unable to experience the challenging but also hugely intellectually rewarding experience of participating in scientific research, but also because the cost to society of excluding women is intolerably high. We need the very best minds going into science, and it stands to reason that if women are excluded, we cut this resource in half. What's more, women bring new ways of thinking and a broader range of ideas to the table, which is crucial for science to flourish. All scientists have a responsibility to be feminists and encourage women to participate in science and fight the barriers that exist. However, this is often more easily said than done. There are several proposed reasons for why women are discouraged from participating in science at a range of levels from primary school children to professors. Among other things, these include a lack of role models and support networks as well as harassment and bullying but also less obvious barriers. For example, unconscious biases in job interviews and letters of reference. In the end, the way to tackle prejudice against women is to increase awareness of the particular challenges faced by female scientists and to put systems in place that promote equal opportunities. Meanwhile, we need outstanding female role models to show unequivocally that women can compete on the same intellectual level as men and encourage other women to follow their lead.                 "explanation": "<p>Treasure (গুপ্তধন) টি কোথায় লুকায়িত আছে, তা সে নিজে ছাড়া কাউকে জানাতে চায়নি। এখানে নিজেই জানা বুঝাতে But Himself বসবে কেননা Himself একটি Reflexive Pronoun. নিজেই নিজের কোন কাজ করা, জানা, হওয়া ইত্যাদি বুঝাতে Reflexive Pronoun ব্যবহৃত হয়। আবার 'কোথায়' বুঝাতে Relative Pronoun 'Where' দ্বিতীয় শূন্যস্থান বসবে।</p>"

                "explanation": "<p><strong>Conditional sentence প্রধানত তিন প্রকার:-</strong></p>\r\n<p><strong>1st Conditional:</strong> If + present Tense + will/can/may + verb (base).</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ex:</strong> If Mita comes, I will go.</p>\r\n<p>তবে এক্ষেত্রে ব্যতিক্রম হল, যদি কোন Habitual fact, Universal Truth&nbsp;বোঝায়, সেক্ষেত্রে If + sub + simple present হবে।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ex:</strong> If I drink coffee, I get a headache.</p>\r\n<p><strong>2nd Conditional:</strong> If + past + would/could/ might + v (base)</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ex:</strong> If she ate sweets, she would lose weight.</p>\r\n<p>ব্যতিক্রম হল 2nd conditional এ be verb এর ক্ষেত্রে কখনও was বসেনা। সব&nbsp;ধরনের person এর সাথে were বসে।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ex:</strong> If I were a bird, I would fly in the sky.</p>\r\n<p><strong>3rd Conditional:&nbsp;</strong>If + past perfect + would have/ could have/might have+ Verb (p.p)</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ex:</strong> If I had known you were coming, I would have&nbsp;gone to the station.</p>\r\n<p>If ছাড়াও conditional sentence গঠিত হতে পারে, এক্ষেত্রে If যুক্ত অংশ question order এ পরিণত হয়ে যায়, অর্থাৎ আগে verb এবং এর পরে subject বসে, এতে অর্থের কোন পরিবর্তন হবে না।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ex:</strong> Had he known anything, he would have told me.</p>"
            }
        ]
    },

                        "text": "It is you who are to leave.",
                        "is_correct": true
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "It is you who is late.",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "It is you who has won the prize.",
                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>যে noun বা pronoun এর পরিবর্তে who ব্যবহৃত হবে, সেই noun বা pronoun এর জন্য যে auxiliary verb টি ব্যবহৃত হওয়ার কথা সেটিই who এর পরে ব্যবহৃত হবে। you এর সাথে are হবে।</p>"

        "unit": "Unit-B",
        "year": "2012",
        "chapter": "Gerund Infinitive, Participle",
        "has_passage": false,
        "passage": null,
        "block": [
            {
                "text": "<p><span>_____ is considered a serious crime.</span></p>",
                "options": [
                    {
                        "text": "Shoplift",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "To shoplifting",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "Shoplifter",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "Shoplifting",
                        "is_correct": true
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>Shop lift - দোকান থেকে কিছু চুরি করা।</p>\r\n<p>Assertive Sentence কখনও Verb এর সাথে base form দিয়ে শুরু হয় না। Verb এর ing যোগ করে Sentence শুরু করা যায়। সেক্ষেত্রে Word টি হয় Gerund নতুবা Present Participle হিসেবে বসে। মনে রাখতে হবে Present Participle [Verb + ing] - noun ও verb এর কাজ করে।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Example:</strong></p>\r\n<p><strong>Present Participle:</strong></p>\r\n<p>A <em>flying </em>bird looks fine - adjective</p>\r\n<p><em>Doing</em> the work, I returned home - verb</p>\r\n<p><strong>Gerund:</strong></p>\r\n<p><strong><em>Swimming</em> </strong>is good for health - Noun</p>\r\n<p>I like you <strong><em>doing</em> </strong>this - Verb</p>\r\n<p>প্রশ্নটিতে Shoplift এর সাথে ing যোগ করলে এটা Gerund তথা Noun হিসেবে কাজ করে। অর্থাৎ, এখানে Shoplifting (চুরি) কে একটি মারাত্মক Crime (অপরাধ) হিসেবে বিবেচনা করা হয়।</p>"
            }
        ]

                    {

                        "is_correct": true
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "Swinging of the monkeys through the tree, th children were delighted.",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "The monkeys swinging through the trees, the children were delighted.",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "Because of monkey's swinging through the trees, the children were delighted.",
                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>প্রশ্নটি Dangling Modifier এর উদাহরণ। Dangling&nbsp;Modifier এর ক্ষেত্রে Verb Subject কে Modify না করে অন্য&nbsp;কিছুকে Modify করে।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Example:</strong> After Jumping out of a boat the snake bit the man.&nbsp;Sentence টি সঠিক নয়। কেননা তখন Sentence টির অর্থ হয় নৌকা&nbsp;হতে Snake টি Jump দিয়ে লোকটিকে কামড় দিয়েছিল।</p>\r\n<p>কিন্ত Sentence টির অর্থ হবে - নৌকা হতে Jump দেওয়ার পর লোকটিকে&nbsp;Shark কামড় দিয়েছিল।</p>\r\n<p>উপরের Sentence এ Modifier (After Jumping) প্রকৃত Sentence কে Modify করতে পারে নি। সঠিক Sentence টি হবে- After jumping out of a boat, the man was bitten by a Shark. আলোচ্য প্রশ্নে 'The children were delighted by the monkey's swinging through the trees.' ছাড়াও অন্যভাবে Sentence টি সঠিক করা যায়- Seeing the swinging of the monkey through the trees, the children were delighted.</p>"

                "explanation": "<table style=\"border-collapse: collapse; width: 38.0075%; height: 180.8px;\" border=\"1\"><colgroup><col style=\"width: 50.5413%;\"><col style=\"width: 49.4055%;\"></colgroup>\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 36px;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong>Countable Qualifier</strong></td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong>Uncountable Qualifier</strong></td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 36px;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Many</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Much</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 36px;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Number of</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Amount of</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 36px;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Few/ a few</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Little/ a little</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 36px;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Several</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Less/ Least</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p>More, Most, All, Any, A lot of, Plenty of, Some, Great deal of এগুলো Countable এবং Uncountable উভয় Noun এর&nbsp;সাথে ব্যবহৃত হতে পারে।</p>\r\n<p>এখানে Hope Uncountable noun তাই little হবে।</p>"

                "explanation": "<p>উপরোক্ত Sentence এ Make Causative Verb হিসেবে&nbsp;ব্যবহৃত হয়েছে।<br>নিচে Causative verb গুলোর ব্যাখ্যা দেয়া হলঃ<br><strong>Make</strong>:</p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>Make এর পরে person or thing যাই থাকুক না কেন Verb এর simple&nbsp;base form বসাতে হবে।</li>\r\n<li>Infinitive বা ing যুক্ত কোন verb use করা যাবে না।</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><strong>Example</strong>: She made the baby take a nap.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; George had made his son be quiet in the theater.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Get </strong>: Get + (verb+to infinitive)<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Get + thing+ (verb এর past participle form)</p>\r\n<p><strong>Example</strong>: Mary got her dog to bring her the newspaper.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; I want to get the house painted before winter.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Have</strong>: Have+person+ (verb এর base form)<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Have+thing+(verb এর past participle form)</p>\r\n<p><strong>Example</strong>: Mary has had a friend type all of her papers.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; We are going to have our car mended.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Dr. Karim had his nurse take the operation.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Let</strong>: Let+thing+(verb এর base form)<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Let+persont (verb এর base form)</p>\r\n<p><strong>Example</strong>: I will not let this machine work.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; We are going to let her write the letter.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Help</strong>: Help এর verb এর simple form অথবা infinitive form দুটিই&nbsp;বসতে পারে। Person অথবা Thing এ কোন পরিবর্তন হবে না।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Example</strong>: Karim helped Rahim wash the car.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Karim helped Rahim to wash the car.</p>"

                ],
                "explanation": "<p>Sentence টির অর্থ সঙ্গতি রক্ষা করার জন্য শূণ্যস্থানে একটি Linker বসাতে হবে। শূণ্যস্থানে Otherwise বসালে Sentence টি অর্থপূর্ণ হয়। কেননা Otherwise এর অর্থ নতুবা/অন্যথায়। বাক্যটি হয়,&nbsp;তোমার টিকেট দেখাও, নতুবা তুমি প্রবেশের অনুমতি পাবে না।</p>\r\n<p>Unless (যেদি না) বসবে না কারণ Unless নিজেই Negative তাই এটা&nbsp;কোন Negative Sentence এ ব্যবহৃত হতে পারে না।</p>\r\n<p>আবার lest ও negative এবং lest যুক্ত Sentence এ Subject এর&nbsp;পর Should/Might বসে।</p>"
            }
        ]

                "explanation": "<p>কিছু গুরুত্বপূর্ণ Literature term -</p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>Verse - ছন্দ</li>\r\n<li>Utopia - কাল্পনিক</li>\r\n<li>Wit - রসময় ও চাতুর্যপূর্ণ অভিব্যক্তি</li>\r\n<li>Irony - বক্তব্যকে জোরালো করতে নিজের বিপরীত কিছু করা বা বলা/ ব্যাঙ্গ করে বলা।</li>\r\n<li>Tragedy - শোকাবহ ঘটনা/ নাটক</li>\r\n<li>Syntax - বাক্যরীতি</li>\r\n<li>Stanza - স্তবক / পংক্তিগুচ্ছ</li>\r\n<li>Simile - উপমা</li>\r\n<li>Allusion - Brief reference to person, event, or place</li>\r\n<li>Epilogue - End of the story</li>\r\n<li>Fable - পৌরাণিক কাহিনী</li>\r\n<li>Sarcasm - তিক্ত মন্তব্য/ উক্তি</li>\r\n<li>Innuendo - ব্যঙ্গোক্তিক</li>\r\n<li>Pun - শব্দের হাস্যরস ব্যবহার</li>\r\n<li>Metaphor - দুটি ভিন্ন জিনিসের সাথে তুলনা</li>\r\n<li>Personification - Giving human qualities to animals on object.</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p>প্রশ্নে, Man এবং Mad dog এর মধ্যে তুলনা করা হয়েছে। অর্থাৎ দুটি&nbsp;ভিন্ন জিনিসের মধ্যে তুলনা করা হয়েছে। তাই এটি Metaphor এর উদাহরণ।</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>"
            }
        ]

                "options": [
                    {
                        "text": "too, cannot , laughing too",

                    },

                        "text": "too, had not, to laugh",

                        "text": "very, would not , to laugh",

                "explanation": "<p>প্রথম Fill in the gap এ, Funny এর পূর্বে too এবং very&nbsp;দুটোই বসতে পারে। কিন্তু Sentence টি সম্পূর্ণ করতে হলে too funny&nbsp;to অনুযায়ী সাজাতে হবে। যা অপশনে নেই, তাই এখানে Very হবে।&nbsp;দ্বিতীয় Fill in the gap এ, এটি একটি past tense সেক্ষেত্রে would not বা&nbsp;could not দুটিই হতে পারে। সেক্ষেত্রে পরবর্তী Option টি দেখতে হবে।&nbsp;সর্বশেষ Fill in the gap এ, শূন্যস্থানের পূর্বে Stop Verb হিসেবে দেয়া&nbsp;আছে। Stop Verb এর পর Gerund (Verb + ing) হয়।</p>"

                        "text": "ring, off",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "holding, ring",
                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>কোন Sentence এ দুটি verb থাকলে দ্বিতীয় verb এর সাথে ing&nbsp;যোগ হয় কিন্তু উদ্দেশ্য বুঝাতে verb এর পূর্বে to হয়। প্রথম শূন্যস্থান দ্বারা&nbsp;কোন উদ্দেশ্য বুঝাচ্ছে না। তাই answering হবে। দ্বিতীয় শূত্যস্থানে&nbsp;Object (it) এর পূর্বে Let দেয়া আছে। Causitive Let এর পরে verb&nbsp;এর base form হয়। নিচে Causative verb গুলোর ব্যাখ্যা দেয়া হল-<br><strong>Make :-</strong> Make এর পরে person or thing যাই থাকুক না কেন&nbsp;Verb এর simple base form বসাতে হবে।<br><strong>- </strong>Infinitive বা ing যুক্ত কোন verb use করা যাবে না।<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Example:- She made the baby take a nap.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;George had made his son be quiet in the theater.<br><strong>Get :- </strong>Get+person + (verb+to infinitive)<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Get+thing+(verb এর past participle form)<br>&nbsp; Example:- Mary got her dog to bring her the newspaper.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;I want to get the house painted before winter.<br><strong>Have:-</strong> Have+person+(verb এর base form)<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Have+thing+(verb এর past participle form)<br>Example:- Mary has had a friend type all of her papers.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;We are going to have our car mended<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Dr. Karim had his nurse take the operation.<br><strong>Let :-</strong> Let+thing+(verb এর base form)<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Let+person+ (verb এর base form)<br>Example:- I will not let this machine work.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; We are going to let her write the letter.<br><strong>Help:-</strong> Help এর verb এর simple form অথবা infinitive form&nbsp;দুটিই বসতে পারে। Person অথবা Thing এ কোন পরিবর্তন হবে না।<br>Example:- Karim helped Rahim wash the car<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Karim helped Rahim to wash the car</p>"
            }

                        "is_correct": true

                    {
                        "text": "imagery",
                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p><strong>Simile </strong>- Simile says you are e like something.<br><strong>Example</strong>: She is as sweet as pie.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Metaphor </strong>- Metaphor says you are something.<br><strong>Example</strong>: You are what you eat.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Hyperbole </strong>- Extreme exaggeration of something.<br><strong>Example </strong>- He was so hungry, he ate that whole cornfield&nbsp;for lunch, stalks, and all.</p>\r\n<p>প্রদত্ত লাইনটিতে 'I' এবং 'Cloud' এর মধ্যে যেভাবে তুলনা করা হয়েছে তা Simile এর উদাহরণ।</p>"
            }

        "unit": "Unit-D",
        "year": "2006",
        "chapter": "Parts of speech",
        "has_passage": false,
        "passage": null,
        "block": [
            {
                "text": "<span>If I found a lost dog, I _____ it to its owner.</span>",
                "options": [
                    {
                        "text": "would return",
                        "is_correct": true
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "will return",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "will returing",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "will have returned",
                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p><strong>Conditional sentence প্রধানত তিন প্রকার:-</strong></p>\r\n<p><strong>1st Conditional</strong>: If + present Tense + will/can/may + verb (base)<br><strong>Ex</strong>: If Mita comes, I will go.</p>\r\n<p>তবে এক্ষেত্রে ব্যতিক্রম হল, যদি কোন Habitual fact, Universal Truth&nbsp;বোঝায়, সেক্ষেত্রে If + sub+simple present হবে।&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; <strong>Ex</strong>: If I drink coffee, I get a headache.</p>\r\n<p><strong>2nd Conditional</strong>: If + past + would/could/ might + v (base)<br><strong>Ex</strong>: If she ate sweets, she would lose weight.</p>\r\n<p>ব্যতিক্রম হল 2nd conditional এ be verb এর ক্ষেত্রে কখনও was বসেনা। সব ধরনের person এর সাথে were বসে।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ex</strong>: If I&nbsp; were a bird, I would fly in the sky.</p>\r\n<p><strong>3rd Conditional</strong>:&nbsp;If + past perfect + would have/ could have/might have + Verb (p.p)<br><strong>Ex</strong>: If I had known you were coming, I would have gone to the station.</p>\r\n<p>If ছাড়াও conditional sentence গঠিত হতে পারে, এক্ষেত্রে If যুক্ত অংশ&nbsp;question order এ পরিণত হয়ে যায়, অর্থাৎ আগে verb এবং এর পরে&nbsp;subject বসে, এতে অর্থের কোন পরিবর্তন হবে না।<br><strong>Ex</strong>: Had he known anything, he would have told me. উপরোক্ত&nbsp;প্রশ্নটি Second Conditional এর উদাহরণ, তাই Would return হবে।</p>"

                    {
                        "text": "neither do I",
                        "is_correct": true
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "I do",
                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "I do either",
                        "is_correct": false
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>Affirmative aggrement সাধারত দুইভাবে করা সম্ভব, নিচে structure দেয়া হল:<br>Negative Statement + And + Subject + Negative auxiliary/be +either<br>Negative Statement + And + Neither + positive auxiliary/be + subject<br>তবে এক্ষেত্রে main clause এ যে verb বসবে দ্বিতীয় clause ও একই&nbsp;tense এ হতে হবে। person অনুযায়ী verb ভিন্ন হতে পারে কিন্তু tense ঠিক&nbsp;থাকতে হবে।<br><strong>Exam</strong>: I am happy and you are too.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;I am happy and so are you.<br><strong>Exam</strong>: She will wear a costume to the party and we will too.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;She will wear a costume to the party and so will we.<br><strong>Exam</strong>: Karim goes to school, and Rahim does too.<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Karim goes to school, and so does Rahim.<br>অনুরূপভাবে You like chocolate, and so do I.</p>\r\n<p>আর Negative agreement ও দুই ভাবে করা যায় নিচের এর structure দেয়া হল-</p>\r\n<p>(i) Affirmative Statement + And + Subject + Verb(auxiliary) + Too</p>\r\n<p>(ii) Affirmative Statement + And + So + Verb(auxiliary) + Subject.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Exam</strong>: Karim hasn't seen the movie yet, and I haven't either<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Karim hasn't seen the movie yet, and neither have I.</p>\r\n<p>আলোচ্য প্রশ্নে যেহেতু Principal clause neagative দেয়া আছে তাই&nbsp;agreement হবে, Neither do I বা don't either.</p>"
            }

                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<table style=\"border-collapse: collapse; width: 86.3712%; height: 527.4px;\" border=\"1\"><colgroup><col style=\"width: 33.3663%;\"><col style=\"width: 33.3663%;\"><col style=\"width: 33.2427%;\"></colgroup>\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 36px;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\"><strong>Tense</strong></td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\"><strong>Active Structure</strong></td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\"><strong>Passive Structure</strong></td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 80.8px;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">1. Present Indefinite</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">\r\n<p>sub + verb + obj</p>\r\n<p>I eat rice</p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub + am/is/are + vpp(+by+obj)&nbsp; Rice is eaten by me</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 80.8px;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">2. Present Continuous</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub+am/is/are + verb-ing + obj&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; I am eating rice</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub + am/is/are being + vpp&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Rice is being eaten by me.</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 90.4px;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">3. Present Perfect</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">\r\n<p>sub + have/has + vpp + o&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; I have eaten rice.</p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub + have/has been + vpp&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Rice has been eaten by me.</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 58.4px;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">4. Past Indefinite</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">Sub + Verb- past + obj&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;I ate rice.</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub + was/were + vpp&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Rice was eaten by me.</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 36px; text-align: center;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">5. Past continuous</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub + was/were + v-ing + obj&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; I was eating rice</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub + was/were being + vpp&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Rice was being eaten by me</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 36px; text-align: center;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">6. Past Perfect</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub + had + vpp+ obj&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; I had eaten rice</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub + had been + vpp&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Rice had been eaten by me&nbsp;</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 36px; text-align: center;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">7. Future Indefinite</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub + shall/will+ verb + obj&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; I shall eat rice</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub+shall/will be+vpp&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Rice will be eaten by me</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 36px; text-align: center;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">8. Future continuous</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub+shall/will be+v-ing+obj&nbsp;</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub+shall/will be being+vpp</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 37px; text-align: center;\">\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">9. Future perfect</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub+shall/will have+vpp+obj</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: left;\">sub+shall/will have been+vpp</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p>উপরোক্ত প্রশ্নে 4 no rule টি প্রযোজ্য হবে।</p>"
            }
        ]

In every known culture, signals, signs, symbols, and gestures are commonly utilized as instruments of communication. There is a great deal of agreement among communication scientists as to what each of these methods is and how each differs from the others. For instance, the basic function of any signal is to impact upon the environment in such a way that it attracts attention, as, for example, the dots and dashes that can be applied to telegraph circuits.         "passage": "<span>Read the passage and answer the questions:</span>\r\n<span>About fifty years ago, plant physiologists set out to grow roots by themselves in solutions in laboratory flasks. The scientists found that the nutrition of isolated roots was quite simple. They required sugar and usual minerals and vitamins. However, they did not require organic nitrogen compounds. These roots got along fine on mineral inorganic nitrogen. Roots are capable of making their own protein and other organ compounds. These activities require energy, of course. The process of respiration uses sugar to make the high-energy compound ATP, which drives the biochemical actions. Respiration also requires oxygen. Highly active roots require a good deal of oxygen.</span>",

                "explanation": "<p>Time Uncountable noun. আর <strong>Uncountable noun</strong> এর পূর্বে <strong>quantifier</strong> হিসেবে <strong>much</strong> বসে। কিছু কিছু noun আছে যারা নিজেরা&nbsp;Uncountable কিন্তু এদের এককগুলো countable অর্থাৎ এককগুলো&nbsp;Plural হতে পারে কিন্তু এদের পরের Verb টি অবশ্যই Singular হবে।</p>\r\n<table style=\"border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; border-width: 1px;\" border=\"1\"><colgroup><col style=\"width: 50.4235%;\"><col style=\"width: 49.8371%;\"></colgroup>\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Time</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">One hour/50 hours</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Money</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">100 dollars/one dollar</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Weight</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">20 Kgs/one Kg</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Length</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">20 meters/one meter</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">Distance</td>\r\n<td style=\"text-align: center;\">20 miles/one mile</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p>উপরোক্ত Noun গুলোর সাথে অবশ্যই Singular verb হবে।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Example:&nbsp;</strong>Four hours is a long time.</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ans:&nbsp;</strong>much</p>"

                "explanation": "<ul>\r\n<li><strong>All</strong> - সব</li>\r\n<li><strong>None</strong> - একটিও না/একজনও না</li>\r\n<li><strong>No one</strong> - একজনও না</li>\r\n<li><strong>Nothing</strong> - কিছু না</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><em>\"আমরা কিছু ক্রয় করতে পারিনি, কারণ একটি দোকানও খোলা ছিল না।\"</em></p>\r\n<p>পরের অংশে যেহেতু Negative অর্থ বহন করে, তাই Negative Marker ব্যবহৃত হবে। No one ব্যবহার করা যাবে না, কেননা এটা শুধুমাত্র ব্যক্তিবাচকের ক্ষেত্রে ব্যবহৃত হয়। Nothing ব্যবহৃত হলে, Sentence টির অর্থ Proper হয় না। আবার, None ব্যক্তিবাচক এবং<br>বস্তুবাচক উভয় ক্ষেত্রেই ব্যবহার করা যায়।</p>\r\n<p><strong>Ans:&nbsp;</strong>none</p>"

                        "is_correct": false
                    },
                    {
                        "text": "Your blame is for nothing when it is counted",
                        "is_correct": true
                    }
                ],
                "explanation": "<p>Rule: Active sentence এর subject টি passive এ Subject থাকবে Auxiliary verb + Complement + When +&nbsp;it + auxiliary + v3.</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><strong>গুরুত্বপূর্ণ কিছু voice change-</strong></span></p>\r\n<p>Active: Honey tastes sweet.<br>Passive: Honey is sweet when it is tasted.<br>Active: The rose smells sweet.<br>Passive: The rose is sweet when it is smelt.<br>Active: This composition reads well.&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Passive: This composition is well when it is read.</p>"
            }
        ]
